title: Zoe Ball and ex-husband Fatboy Slim support son Woody on The Circle
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Zoe Ball and ex-husband Fatboy Slim came together to send a message of support to son Woody as he nears The Circle final.

The 18-year-old student has become one of the favourites on the Channel 4 reality show, and received a special message from his parents which will air on tonight’s show.

Coming directly from Woody’s cupboard, Zoe and Fatboy, real name Norman Cook, were joined by their nine-year-old daughter Nelly.

‘Since you’ve been gone we’ve been living in your cupboard in your bedroom and really missing you,’ Zoe said.

Zoe Ball, Fatboy Slim and their daughter Nelly (Picture: Channel 4)

‘We just wanted to say how super proud we are of you. You’ve been absolutely amazing. I know when you said you first wanted to go on The Circle we were a bit in horror.

‘You’ve been so full of love, totally daft, showing your magic, been so super clever. You’ve been absolutely smashing it, darling.

‘We are so proud of you. Your cousins, aunts, and uncles, even your nana and grandad have been using hashtags.’

Fatboy added: ‘Please come home soon though. We’re very proud of you.’

Zoe also wrote a message of support on Instagram, writing: ‘So super proud of our best boy Woody as @cvthecircle draws to a climactic finale this week.

‘He’s been true to himself, full of love, honesty & daftness. He is made of pure magic & we cant wait to cuddle him & have him home. Hope he brings Tim, Ella, Emelle, Sy & co for tea soon.

‘Appreciate there’s been some incredible game playing but as Sammy/James would say I can’t lie – it’s been an emotional watch at times. Stay golden woo. Whoever wins on Friday, it’s really been smashing telly.’

The winner of The Circle will bag a £100,000 cash prize, with Woody, Ella May, Georgina Aurelia Elliott, Tim Wilson, James Doran (as single mum Sammie), and Paddy Smyth all left in the game.

The Circle continues on Channel 4 tonight at 10pm.
